|ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Atheros;AR8327N; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = B8:A3:86 |oui = B8:A3:86 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = Mini PCIe,USB 3.0,SD Card |exp_minipcie_num = 2 |exp_usb_num = 1 |exp_sdmmc_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = PCIe Switch (wireless module);Pericom PI7C9X20303SL;Pericom;PI7C9X20303SL;;1; |802dot11_protocols = abgn |defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = Admin |defaultpass = |defaultssid = dlink,dlink_media |defaultssid_regex = ^dlink$,,,^dlink_media$ |default_ch = |manuf = Cameo |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 11/29/2011 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 790069352218 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B0068ALVAO |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = D-Link DIR-857MO1 |rad1modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9380; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = D-Link DIR-857MO1 |rad2modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad2chip1 = Atheros;AR9380; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The FCC ID covers the daughterboard for the unit.
The daughterboard is a Cameo product and it is assumed the main board is also OEM Cameo.
There is a '''Pericom''' packet switch on the wireless module board, same as the [[D-Link DIR-827]]. {{WiFiCert|WFA12841|10/14/2011}} ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dlink.com/us/en/support/product/dir-857-dualband-hd-media-router Support page]
[ftp://ftp.dlink.eu/datasheets/DIR-857.pdf Datasheet] (EU) ===Reviews=== * [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31788-d-link-dir-857-hd-media-router-3000-reviewed on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :This device appears to share the same basic hardware as the [[D-Link DIR-827]]. :'''dlink''' (2.4GHz) and '''dlink_media''' (5GHz) default SSIDs * [http://www.redeszone.net/d-link/dir-857-n900/ Review on '''redes-zone'''] (w/ high-res photos) :B8:A3:86 OUI :12V, 2A power * [http://us.hardware.info/reviews/2892/3/d-link-dir-857-router-review-including-usb-30-and-sd-pci-e Review on '''uk.hardware.info'''] (w/ fairly high-res board shots) :B8:A3:86 OUI * [http://www.foxnetwork.ru/index.php/en/component/content/article/124-d-link-dir-857.html Review on '''FoxNetWork'''] : The main elements of the other board are placed on one side. A [[Ubicom]] IP8000AU chip is used as a SoC processor. : RAM is represented by two 256 Mbytes [http://www.nanya.com/PageEdition3.aspx?Menu_ID=109&def=210&lan=en-us NANYA NT5CB128M16BP] modules meaning that the overall RAM available to the device is 512 Mbytes. : One of them performs the sole function of a wireless module and uses a PCI-E [http://www.pericom.com/assets/Databriefs/PI7C9X20303SL_db.pdf Pericom PI7C9X20303SL] switch. ==Pictures==
